result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph F. Soulier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Meet with DOC representative within 48 hours.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF43

miscConds.notes: Court costs and surcharges totaling $543.00.  Cash bond applied from 14CF50.  Cash bond on this case to be refunded.
Domestic abuse, anger management and cognitive behavior counseling and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
Defendant not to frequent establishments whose primary source of income is from the sale of alcoholic beverages.  No illegal drugs or alcohol.  Prescription drugs only as prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.  Contact with Willow L. or Nicole B. to be determined by DOC agent.  Other conditions as set by DOC agent.  Credit for time served of 4 days if any future jail time imposed.    Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Huber release granted, hours and conditions to be set by Sheriff's Dept. where jail sentence will be served.  Programming as directed by the Criminal Justice Office at the Bayfield County Jail and get credit for successful completion of of the same as calculated by the jail.  Remanded to the custody of the Bayfield Co. Sherriff's Dept. to continue serving.
Concurrent with: 14CF43

Amended 2-29-2016:  Concurrent to 14CF50, 14CF43, and 14CF54.
